instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3536: What is 820-3536? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.C7125: What is C7125? Capacitor between CHGR_BOOT and CHGR_PHASE important for bootstrapping creation of PPBUS_G3H on 2013-2015 macbook pros.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power. Green light on charger
threads.message:
I have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A that has no power. Green light on charger. Laptop has had spill damage.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER3V3</SIGNAL> measured at pin 23 of <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> reads as 1v. How is this generated?
No <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> or <SIGNAL>PP3V_S0</SIGNAL>

No <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> at pin 2 of <RESISTOR>R5400</RESISTOR>.

My power supply is showing it's pulling .01amps when adapter is connected.  Suggestions on where to start?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power. Green light on charger
threads.message: So PPBUS is missing. Short to GND on PPBUS? Checked around the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power. Green light on charger
threads.message: I have PPBUS coming in at the DC in jack and through the F7700 fuse and surrounding capacitors at 18.5v.  It seems to be missing when it goes to the other side of the board.  What's normal reading in diode mode for GND & PPBUS? Will look around <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> when I get back to my shop.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power. Green light on charger
threads.message: PPBUS measurement varies by board, just check it and it should not be shorted at least. PPBUS is certainly not coming in at the DC jack, please look at the diagram and avoid such misunderstandings. PPBUS is generated by <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> from DCIN rail.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power. Green light on charger
threads.message: Short on PPBUS to GND. Also short on <CAPACITOR>C7125</CAPACITOR> pin 2 GND and via broken <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> and pin 23 to pin 2 <CAPACITOR>C7125</CAPACITOR>. Think this one will go to the donor pile!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power. Green light on charger
threads.message: Uhm, could be as simple as <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> and the FET. Remove F7140 and see if the system side is OK.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power. Green light on charger
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power. Green light on charger
threads.message:
Removed F7140 and I get .71v on pin 2 & 0v on pin 1
.506 Ohms on pin 2 diode mode
.045 Ohms on pin 1 diode mode

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power. Green light on charger
threads.message: So the short is on the ISL side which is good! Replace ISL and <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> and check all resistors and traces around the ISL.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power. Green light on charger
threads.message: thanks. i have the ISL.  Do you know of a source for the <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> MOSFET? DigiKey and Mouser don't seem to have it in their inventory.  I have a few donor boards but I don't trust them for parts in that area.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power. Green light on charger
threads.message: Donor boards are fine for that. <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> almost never dies.
